titlestmt.titleproper: Examinar magazines with article on the ANS headquarters building at Audubon Terrace, 1906
titlestmt.author: Arnold Tescher

profiledesc.creation: Finding aid encoded by David Hill using EADitor ©2011

did.head: Descriptive Summary
did.unittitle: Examinar magazines with article on the ANS headquarters building at Audubon Terrace
did.abstract: Three copies of the Examiner containing an article on the ANS headquarters building at Audubon Terrace.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content Note
scopecontent.p: Three copies of the Examiner (vol. 84, no. 18, May 3, 1906), a weekly Baptist newspaper, published at 38 Park Row, New York City. The issue contains an article about the ANS’s prospective new building to be erected in Audubon Park along West 156th Street in New York City, adjacent to the larger Hispanic Society of America building, both buildings designed by the same architect, Charles P. Huntington. Provides a short history of the ANS and a brief description of its holdings. The newspaper also contains a short eyewitness account of the San Francisco earthquake, written on April 24, 1906, just five days after the disaster. Of interest are the newspaper’s many advertisements for cure-all remedies.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: Examinar magazines with article on the ANS headquarters building at Audubon Terrace, 1906, Archives, American Numismatic Society.

userestrict.head: Restrictions
userestrict.p: Copyright restrictions may apply. Permission to publish or reproduce must be secured from the American Numismatic Society.
